"KEA staff (qualified)" refers to individuals who work in caregiving positions and have the necessary qualifications for that job. The most accurate paraphrase of this term in Japanese would be "介護職（有資格）," which directly translates to "caregiving job (with qualifications)."

Option A, "介護職," simply refers to the job itself without specifying the qualifications of the person holding the position. Option C, "介護職（無資格）," refers to caregiving jobs without qualifications. Option D, "介護職/正社員," is not correct because it implies that all caregivers are full-time employees, which is not necessarily true. Option E, "介護職/パート・アルバイト," implies that all caregivers are part-time or casual workers, which is also not necessarily true. Option F and G, "介護職（有資格）/正社員 and 介護職（有資格）/パート・アルバイト" are not correct because they imply that the employee's qualifications determine their employment type (whether they are full-time or part-time), which is not the case.
